1.title: Belief

episode of.title: Focus: What Drives the World's Top Athletes (TV Series 2013– )

1.plot: When the odds are against, many succumb to the pressure and concede defeat. Overcoming the odds is what sport is all about. But for America's Cup sailor James 'Jimmy' Spithill and Paralympian Kelly Cartwright, they've defeated greater odds than most; demonstrating that the true extent of the human spirit and one's self-belief is immeasurable.

2.title: Progression

episode of.title: Focus: What Drives the World's Top Athletes (TV Series 2013– )

2.plot: Defiance breeds progression. And when faced with either conforming to the norm or risking it all, history demonstrates that those "crazy" few who choose the latter often become our pioneers. Olympic triathlete Courtney Atkinson and free-runner Ryan Doyle are on a quest to move themselves and their respective sports forward.

3.title: Evolution

episode of.title: Focus: What Drives the World's Top Athletes (TV Series 2013– )

3.plot: Charles Darwin's theory of evolution applies as much to an athlete's career as it does to mankind. For professional skateboarder Ryan Sheckler and aerobatic pilot Hannes Arc, it truly is a matter of evolving or watching their careers die a slow death. Their sports may be worlds and 10,000 ft of air space apart but the two share a commonality: evolving their skill sets.

4.title: Personal Best

episode of.title: Focus: What Drives the World's Top Athletes (TV Series 2013– )

4.plot: Hang glider Jon Durand and rock climber Sasha DiGiulian may not share much in common on the surface, but under the guise of their respective sports, they share a common competitor: themselves. Find out what lengths two of the world's most daring athletes go to in the quest for reaching their personal best.

5.title: Innovation

episode of.title: Focus: What Drives the World's Top Athletes (TV Series 2013– )

5.plot: Innovation, however big or small, is the lifeblood of professional sport and it's those daring enough to inspire and create change that are the real heroes. Big wave surfer Mark Mathews took the more traditional route to create the most innovative surf event of the 21st Century. Street trial rider Danny MacAskill opted for the contemporary route: a mate, a camera, a computer and YouTube. Both athletes have brought their sports into the global spotlight.

6.title: Glory

episode of.title: Focus: What Drives the World's Top Athletes (TV Series 2013– )

6.plot: Glory. Every athlete chases it but when presented with an opportunity to seize it - that's when the most exceptional athletes separate themselves from the rest. For child prodigies Daniel Ricciardo and Jess Fox, they're under more pressure than most to prove a life's worth of hype will cement them as some of the best athletes of their generation.

1.title: Fear

episode of.title: Focus: What Drives the World's Top Athletes (TV Series 2013– )

1.plot: In Episode 1 of Focus, we take an inside look at how motocross superstar Robbie Maddison and Brazilian surfer Maya Gabeira face fear.

2.title: Motivation

episode of.title: Focus: What Drives the World's Top Athletes (TV Series 2013– )

2.plot: The second episode of the series centers around motivation and the challenges veterans Craig Lowndes and Ryan Sandes face in rediscovering the drive that saw them crowned champions of their respective sports during the infancy of their careers.

3.title: Expectations

episode of.title: Focus: What Drives the World's Top Athletes (TV Series 2013– )

3.plot: The third episode of the series centers around the expectations of Julian Wilson and Lexi Thompson. Their faces graced the pages of magazines the world over before they were even tall enough to reach the newsstand counter. But when your reputation precedes you for nearly half a decade before you turn pro, the weight of expectation can become an avalanche and bring one crashing back down to earth.

4.title: Choices

episode of.title: Focus: What Drives the World's Top Athletes (TV Series 2013– )

4.plot: International freestyle BMX champion Corey Bohan contemplates giving up the sport he loves to pursue a Hollywood lifestyle. Athlete Ellyse Perry is charged with making her own career-defining decision - which sport does she forfeit to prolong her career, soccer or cricket?

5.title: Fresh Challenges

episode of.title: Focus: What Drives the World's Top Athletes (TV Series 2013– )

5.plot: In this episode, we document how Tim Cahill and Ben Brown attempt to push their respective boundaries even further, as they perpetually seek the undiscovered in an effort to redefine themselves and what it is to be a professional athlete.

6.title: Mentors

episode of.title: Focus: What Drives the World's Top Athletes (TV Series 2013– )

6.plot: As Mark Webber winds down his F1 career and Mick Fanning contemplates a future beyond the world surfing tour, the pair reveals that they're determined not to bury their secrets with them but give back to the sports that made them household names.

imdb.plot outline: Focus provides an intimate insight into what drives the world's top athletes. This fly on the wall series crisscrosses the globe following the most accomplished athletic stars and provides viewers with a rare and intimate look into the extraordinary lives of elite athletes.
imdb.title: Focus: What Drives the World's Top Athletes
akas: Focus: What Drives the World's Top Athletes (Australia)
plot: Focus showcases what it is that drives the top athletes of 2013. We look into the minds of these individuals as they reflect on the most memorable experiences in their careers.::Milkmoney

Focus provides an intimate insight into what drives the world's top athletes. This fly on the wall series crisscrosses the globe following the most accomplished athletic stars and provides viewers with a rare and intimate look into the extraordinary lives of elite athletes.::Milkmoney
